Author: akkartik
Content:
A bigger issue with RSS: it's designed for updates rather than archival. While XML may be a good idea, I don't think there's any reason to go with RSS.

I just took a look at studystickies after a few weeks. It's coming along great!

Author: brett
Content:
Quickstart or otherwise it would still seem like better idea to figure out how to get an introduction. I could be missing the point of the program, but my guess is that an unsolicited email to a VC firm is still an unsolicited email to a VC firm.

Do you, or anyone, have experience to the contrary?

Author: staunch
Content: Bandwidth and storage costs could easily get into the millions over a year or two.

Author: paul
Content:
It's somewhat amusing, but also mildly depressing, to see these remarks despite the fact that I explicitly stated (in bold, even), that "I'm not advising you to ditch your database!"

And yet somehow that gets translated into "get rid of that database."

Author: staunch
Content:
If some user of your site is mistakenly killed by an over zealous police officer, you may have some liability issues. I'd probably get a lawyer to write up a strong disclaimer at least.

As for the PR -- I'd say it's a win. People who are going to be interested will find out about you and the controversy makes you interesting.\n

Author: nickb
Content: Parasites joining other parasites... oh well.
